content: This is a **list of the bird species recorded in Singapore**. The avifauna of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) include a total of 450 species, 35 of which have been [introduced](/wiki/Introduced_species) by humans. This list's [taxonomic](/wiki/Taxonomy_(biology)) treatment (designation and sequence of orders, families and species) and nomenclature (common and scientific names) follow the conventions of *[The Clements Checklist of Birds of the World](/wiki/The_Clements_Checklist_of_Birds_of_the_World)*, 2023b edition. The family accounts at the beginning of each heading reflect this taxonomy, as do the species counts found in each family account. The following tags have been used to highlight several categories, but not all species fall into one of these categories. Those that do not are commonly occurring native species. ## Abundance - Very common (**VC**) - found almost all the time in suitable locations - Common (**C**) - found most of the time in suitable locations - Uncommon (**U**) - found some of the time - Rare (**R**) - found several times a year - Very rare (**VR**) - not found every year - Extirpated (**Ex**) - used to be found in Singapore, but not any more ## Status - Resident (**R**) - stays throughout the year without known breeding record - Resident breeder (**RB**) - stays throughout the year with known breeding record - Winter visitor (**WV**) - spends months at wintering site - Passage migrant (**PM**) - spends days to weeks at wintering site - Migrant breeder (**MB**) - breeds locally, but winters elsewhere - Non-breeding visitor (**NBV**) - can be found throughout the year for days to months, but does not breed locally - Vagrant (**V**) - not usually found locally - Introduced (**I**) - either released or escaped birds - Reintroduced (**rI**) - previously extirpated, but has been re-introduced into the wild ## Locations There are many locations for bird watching in Singapore. The habitats include forests, mangroves, rivers, coasts, grasslands, woodlands, marshes, and offshore islands. There are no mountains in Singapore, but there are several hills, i.e., "bukit" (**Bt.**) in the Malay language. The [house crow](/wiki/House_crow) is the most successful introduced bird in Singapore. It was originally brought in from [Sri Lanka](/wiki/Sri_Lanka) for the purpose of controlling the caterpillar population, but the plan back-fired and instead of attacking the caterpillars, they became a pest. Prior to the COVID-19 pandemic, crow cullings were common in Singapore and were guided by the [Certis CISCO](/wiki/Certis_CISCO). Crow cullings were discontinued since the COVID-19 pandemic. Many of the areas were largely cleared for redevelopment, such as Tengah New Town. The expiring leases of Neo Tiew in 2014 were also given to Ministry of Defence (MINDEF) restricted area. [Jurong Eco-Garden](/wiki/CleanTech_Park) (**JEG**)Most of it are restricted access including the four reservoirs, except for Nanyang Technological University and Cleantech Park. Bird watchers secretly enter military and live firing premises without getting caught by the security or military warden. ## Waterfowl Order: [Anseriformes](/wiki/Anseriformes) Family: [Anatidae](/wiki/Anatidae) Anatidae includes the [ducks](/wiki/Duck) and most duck-like waterfowl, such as [geese](/wiki/Goose) and [swans](/wiki/Swan). These birds are adapted to an aquatic existence with webbed feet, flattened bills, and feathers that are excellent at shedding water due to an oily coating. - Wandering whistling duck (*[Dendrocygna arcuata](/wiki/Dendrocygna_arcuata)*) - U/IRB - SBG, SBTB, WCP, *Marina East, Marina South, P. Punggol* - Lesser whistling duck (*[Dendrocygna javanica](/wiki/Dendrocygna_javanica)*) - U/RB - Halus, Jurong Central Park, Kranji Marsh, SBTB, SBG, SBWR, WCP, Yishun, *P. Punggol, S. Serangoon* - Cotton pygmy-goose (*[Nettapus coromandelianus](/wiki/Nettapus_coromandelianus)*) - VR/NBV - BAMKP, CCNR, Halus, Kranji Marsh, LSR, SBTB, Seletar East, *Marina South, WWC (Poyan), WCP* - Garganey (*[Spatula querquedula](/wiki/Spatula_querquedula)*) - R/WV - Changi, CCNR, Halus, WWC (Poyan), SBWR, Tuas, *Marina South, Tanah Merah* - Northern shoveler (*[Spatula clypeata](/wiki/Spatula_clypeata)*) - VR/WV - Changi, Halus, WWC (Poyan), SBWR (2008) - Gadwall (*[Mareca strepera](/wiki/Mareca_strepera)*) - VR/V - *Punggol (1989)*, SBWR (2020) - Eurasian wigeon (*[Mareca penelope](/wiki/Mareca_penelope)*) - VR/V - Kranji Marsh (2018), SBWR (1986-7) - Northern pintail (*[Anas acuta](/wiki/Anas_acuta)*) - VR/WV - SBWR (2016, 2020), *WWC (Poyan,* Wrexham*), Senoko, S. Jurong (1978)* - Tufted duck (*[Aythya fuligula](/wiki/Aythya_fuligula)*) - V - *Changi (1999)*, Marsiling Park (2020), SBWR/Kranji Marsh (2023) ## Pheasants, grouse, junglefowl, quails and allies Order: [Galliformes](/wiki/Galliformes) Family: [Phasianidae](/wiki/Phasianidae) The Phasianidae are a family of terrestrial birds. In general, they are plump (although they vary in size) and have broad, relatively short wings. - Blue-breasted quail (*[Synoicus chinensis](/wiki/Synoicus_chinensis)*) - U/RB - Changi, Halus, JLG, NTL, Pasir Ris Farmway, P. Punggol, Punggol, SBWR, Tuas - Red junglefowl (*[Gallus gallus](/wiki/Gallus_gallus)*) - C/RB+IRB - - Changi District (Grand Venture Technology): Pasir Ris, Tampines, Simei, Changi Village, Changi - Kaki Bukit District (Axiom Tab): Kaki Bukit, Kampong Ubi - North East District: Hougang, Serangoon Gardens - Bukit Timah District: Botanic Gardens, Bukit Timah - Fort Canning District: Fort Canning, Oxley Road, Dhoby Ghaut - Gardens by the Bay - Thomson District: Thomson, MacRitchie Reservoir, Bishan Park, Bishan, Ang Mo Kio - Chinatown District: Chinatown, Amoy Street - Ayer Rajah District: Clementi, Singapore Polytechnic, Science Park, Alexandra Hospital, Henderson, Kim Tian, Kampong Bahru, Labrador Park - Bukit Panjang District: Bukit Panjang ## Grebes Order: [Podicipediformes](/wiki/Podicipediformes) Family: [Podicipedidae](/wiki/Podicipedidae) [Grebes](/wiki/Grebe) are small to medium-large freshwater diving birds. They have lobed toes and are excellent swimmers and divers. However, they have their feet placed far back on the body, making them quite ungainly on land. - Little grebe (*[Tachybaptus ruficollis](/wiki/Tachybaptus_ruficollis)*) - VR/RB - Halus, Rasir Ris Farmway, P. These birds are of variable size with slender bodies, long tails and strong legs. The Old World cuckoos are [brood parasites](/wiki/Brood_parasite). - Greater coucal (*[Centropus sinensis](/wiki/Centropus_sinensis)*) - U/RB - woodlands: CCNR, Halus, Mandai, NTL, WWC (Poyan), PRP, SBG, SBWR, TBHP, Venus Drive - Lesser coucal (*[Centropus bengalensis](/wiki/Centropus_bengalensis)*) - C/RB - grasslands - Chestnut-bellied malkoha (*[Phaenicophaeus sumatranus](/wiki/Phaenicophaeus_sumatranus)*) - U/RB - BTNR, CCNR, DFNP, JEG, Mandai, WWC (Poyan), TBHP - Chestnut-winged cuckoo (*[Clamator coromandus](/wiki/Clamator_coromandus)*) - U/WVPM - Bidadari, CCNR, Changi, SBTB, Halus, JEG, JLG, WWC (Murai, Thousand Oaks, Poyan), PRP, P. Punggol, SBG, SBWR, Sembawang, Sentosa, Tuas - Himalayan cuckoo (*[Cuculus saturatus](/wiki/Cuculus_saturatus)*) - R/PM - Bidadari, BBNP, CCNR, Coney Is., JLG, Tuas ## Nightjars and allies Order: [Caprimulgiformes](/wiki/Caprimulgiformes) Family: [Caprimulgidae](/wiki/Caprimulgidae) [Nightjars](/wiki/Nightjar) are medium-sized nocturnal birds that usually nest on the ground. They have long wings, short legs and very short bills. Most have small feet, of little use for walking, and long pointed wings. Their soft plumage is camouflaged to resemble bark or leaves. - Malaysian eared-nightjar (*[Lyncornis temminckii](/wiki/Lyncornis_temminckii)*) - *Ex/R* - BBNP, CCNR - Grey nightjar (*[Caprimulgus jotaka](/wiki/Caprimulgus_jotaka)*) - U/WVPM - Bidadari, CCNR, Changi, JLG, SBWR, TBHP - Large-tailed nightjar (*[Caprimulgus macrurus](/wiki/Caprimulgus_macrurus)*) - C/RB - woodlands - Savanna nightjar (*[Caprimulgus affinis](/wiki/Caprimulgus_affinis)*) - U/RB - grasslands: Changi, Halus, NTL, P. Ubin, Punggol, Seletar East, TEG, Tuas ## Swifts Order: [Caprimulgiformes](/wiki/Caprimulgiformes) Family: [Apodidae](/wiki/Apodidae) [Swifts](/wiki/Swift_(bird)) are small birds which spend the majority of their lives flying. These birds have very short legs and never settle voluntarily on the ground, perching instead only on vertical surfaces. Many swifts have long swept-back wings which resemble a crescent or boomerang. - Silver-rumped needletail (*[Rhaphidura leucopygialis](/wiki/Rhaphidura_leucopygialis)*) - VR/NBV - CCNR, Changi, WWC (Poyan) - White-throated needletail (*[Hirundapus caudacutus](/wiki/Hirundapus_caudacutus)*) - VR/PM - BTNR, CCNR, Henderson Waves - Silver-backed needletail (*[Hirundapus cochinchinensis](/wiki/Hirundapus_cochinchinensis)*) - R/WVPM - BTNR, CCNR, DFNP, Henderson Waves - Brown-backed needletail (*[Hirundapus giganteus](/wiki/Hirundapus_giganteus)*) - U/WVPM - BTNR, CCNR, Henderson Waves, Marina East, P. Ubin - Plume-toed swiftlet (*[Collocalia affinis](/wiki/Collocalia_affinis)*) - U/R - BBNP, BTNR, CCNR, DFNP, Henderson Waves, MFP, SBG - Black-nest swiftlet (*[Aerodramus maximus](/wiki/Aerodramus_maximus)*) - C/RB - islandwide, including offshore islands - Germain's swiftlet (*[Aerodramus germani](/wiki/Aerodramus_germani)*) - C/RB - islandwide, including offshore islands - Common swift (*[Apus apus](/wiki/Apus_apus)*) - VR/V - CCNR, Henderson Waves - Pacific swift (*[Apus pacificus](/wiki/Apus_pacificus)*) - U/WVPM - BTNR, CCNR, KRP, P. Ubin, Singapore Strait, Tuas - House swift (*[Apus nipalensis](/wiki/Apus_nipalensis)*) - U/RB - Buangkok, Changi, CCNR, DFNP, Halus, Henderson Waves, NTL, P. Punggol, P. Ubin, Tuas - Asian palm-swift (*[Cypsiurus balasiensis](/wiki/Cypsiurus_balasiensis)*) - U/RB - BTNR, CCKC, CCNR, Halus, KRP, WWC (Poyan), P. Ubin ## Treeswifts Order: [Caprimulgiformes](/wiki/Caprimulgiformes) Family: [Hemiprocnidae](/wiki/Hemiprocnidae) The treeswifts, also called crested swifts, are closely related to the [true swifts](/wiki/Swift_(bird)). They differ from the other swifts in that they have crests, long forked tails and softer plumage. - Grey-rumped treeswift (*[Hemiprocne longipennis](/wiki/Hemiprocne_longipennis)*) - U/RB - BAMKP, BBNP, Bidadari, CCNR, KRP, Mandai, SBG, TBHP - Whiskered treeswift (*[Hemiprocne comata](/wiki/Hemiprocne_comata)*) - *Ex/RB* + VR/NBV - BTNR, CCNR, Dairy Farm ## Rails, gallinules and coots Order: [Gruiformes](/wiki/Gruiformes) Family: [Rallidae](/wiki/Rallidae) Rallidae is a large family of small to medium-sized birds which includes the [rails](/wiki/Rail_(bird)), [crakes](/wiki/Crake), [coots](/wiki/Coot) and [gallinules](/wiki/Rallidae). Typically they inhabit dense vegetation in damp environments near lakes, swamps or rivers. In general they are shy and secretive birds, making them difficult to observe. Most species have strong legs and long toes which are well adapted to soft uneven surfaces. They tend to have short, rounded wings and to be weak fliers. - Slaty-breasted rail (*[Lewinia striata](/wiki/Lewinia_striata)*) - U/RB - tall grass areas - Eurasian moorhen (*[Gallinula chloropus](/wiki/Gallinula_chloropus)*) - U/RB - BAMKP, Halus, Kranji Marsh, Lim Chu Kang Lane 3, Marina East, One-North, WWC (Poyan), SBG, WCP, *Marina South, P. Punggol, Serangoon* - Eurasian coot (*[Fulica atra](/wiki/Fulica_atra)*) - VR/V - *WWC (Poyan)* - Black-backed swamphen (*[Porphyrio indicus](/wiki/Porphyrio_indicus)*) - VR/NBV - CBP, Kranji Marsh - Grey-headed swamphen (*[Porphyrio poliocephalus](/wiki/Porphyrio_poliocephalus)*) - *R/RB* - *Halus, Kranji Marsh, Neo Tiew, WWC (Poyan), TEG* - Watercock (*[Gallicrex cinerea](/wiki/Gallicrex_cinerea)*) - U/WV - Changi, Halus, Jurong East, Kranji Marsh, Marina East, WWC (Poyan), SBG, SBWR, Tuas, *Khatib Bongsu*, *Marina South* - White-breasted waterhen (*[Amaurornis phoenicurus](/wiki/Amaurornis_phoenicurus)*) - C/RBWV - islandwide - White-browed crake (*[Poliolimnas cinereus](/wiki/Poliolimnas_cinereus)*) - U/RB - Halus, Kranji Marsh, SBWR, *Punggol* - Red-legged crake (*[Rallina fasciata](/wiki/Rallina_fasciata)*) - U/RBWV - BBNP, BBC, BTNR, CCNR, Halus, MFP, P. Punggol, Tampines, Tuas, *Marina South* - Band-bellied crake (*[Zapornia paykullii](/wiki/Porzana_paykullii)*) - VR/PM - Bedok, CCNR, JLG, Lor Lada Hitam, SBG, Venus Drive - Baillon's crake (*[Zapornia pusilla](/wiki/Zapornia_pusilla)*) - R/WVPM - Bt. Batok, Halus, Marina East, NTL, SBTB, Tampines, Tuas, P. Punggol ## Finfoots Order: [Gruiformes](/wiki/Gruiformes) Family: [Heliornithidae](/wiki/Heliornithidae) Heliornithidae is a small family of tropical birds with webbed lobes on their feet similar to those of grebes and coots. - Masked finfoot (*[Heliopais personatus](/wiki/Heliopais_personatus)*) - V - SBWR (1999), USR (2002, 2010) ## Thick-knees Order: [Charadriiformes](/wiki/Charadriiformes) Family: [Burhinidae](/wiki/Burhinidae) The thick-knees are a group of largely tropical waders in the family Burhinidae. They are found worldwide within the tropical zone, with some species also breeding in temperate Europe and Australia. They are medium to large waders with strong black or yellow-black bills, large yellow eyes and cryptic plumage. Despite being classed as waders, most species have a preference for arid or semi-arid habitats. - Beach thick-knee (*[Esacus magnirostris](/wiki/Esacus_magnirostris)*) - **Ex/R** - Southern Islands ## Stilts and avocets Order: [Charadriiformes](/wiki/Charadriiformes) Family: [Recurvirostridae](/wiki/Recurvirostridae) Recurvirostridae is a family of large wading birds, which includes the [avocets](/wiki/Avocet) and [stilts](/wiki/Stilt). The avocets have long legs and long up-curved bills. Ubin, SBWR - Plain sunbird (*[Anthreptes simplex](/wiki/Anthreptes_simplex)*) - VR/R - *CCNR, Senoko* - Brown-throated sunbird (*[Anthreptes malacensis](/wiki/Anthreptes_malacensis)*) - C/RB - parks - Van Hasselt's sunbird (*[Leptocoma brasiliana](/wiki/Leptocoma_brasiliana)*) - U/RB - BBNP, BTNR, CCNR, P. Ubin - Copper-throated sunbird (*[Leptocoma calcostetha](/wiki/Nectarinia_calcostetha)*) - U/RB - BBNP, P. Ubin, SBWR - Ornate sunbird (*[Cinnyris jugularis](/wiki/Cinnyris_jugularis)*) - VC/RB - parks - Crimson sunbird (*[Aethopyga siparaja](/wiki/Aethopyga_siparaja)*) - C/RB - parks, forests - Thick-billed spiderhunter (*[Arachnothera crassirostris](/wiki/Arachnothera_crassirostris)*) - *Ex/R* + VR/R - *BTNR, CCNR* - Little spiderhunter (*[Arachnothera longirostra](/wiki/Arachnothera_longirostra)*) - U/RB - BBNP, BTNR, CCNR, DFNP, Mandai, P. Ubin - Yellow-eared spiderhunter (*[Arachnothera chrysogenys](/wiki/Arachnothera_chrysogenys)*) - *Ex/R* + VR/V - *BTNR, CCNR, P. Tekong, P. Ubin* ## Fairy-bluebirds Order: [Passeriformes](/wiki/Passeriformes) Family: [Irenidae](/wiki/Irenidae) The fairy-bluebirds are [bulbul](/wiki/Bulbul)-like birds of open forest or thorn scrub. The males are dark-blue and the females a duller green. - Asian fairy-bluebird (*[Irena puella](/wiki/Irena_puella)*) - U/RB - BBNP, BBC, BTNR, CCNR, DFNP ## Leafbirds Order: [Passeriformes](/wiki/Passeriformes) Family: [Chloropseidae](/wiki/Chloropseidae) The leafbirds are small, [bulbul](/wiki/Bulbul)-like birds. The males are brightly plumaged, usually in greens and yellows. - Greater green leafbird (*[Chloropsis sonnerati](/wiki/Chloropsis_sonnerati)*) - U/RB - BTNR, CCNR, DFNP - Lesser green leafbird (*[Chloropsis cyanopogon](/wiki/Chloropsis_cyanopogon)*) - R/RB - BTNR, CCNR, DFNP, P. Ubin - Blue-winged leafbird (*[Chloropsis cochinchinensis](/wiki/Chloropsis_cochinchinensis)*) - U/RB - BTNR, CCNR, DFNP ## Weavers and allies Order: [Passeriformes](/wiki/Passeriformes) Family: [Ploceidae](/wiki/Ploceidae) The weavers are small passerine birds related to the [finches](/wiki/Finch). They are seed-eating birds with rounded conical bills. The males of many species are brightly coloured, usually in red or yellow and black, some species show variation in colour only in the breeding season. - Golden-backed weaver (*[Ploceus jacksoni](/wiki/Ploceus_jacksoni)*) - U/IRB - Coney Is., Halus, Marina East, NTL, P. Punggol - Streaked weaver (*[Ploceus manyar](/wiki/Ploceus_manyar)*) - R/IRB - Halus, SBWR, *Khatib Bongsu*, *Sg. Serangoon* - Baya weaver (*[Ploceus philippinus](/wiki/Ploceus_philippinus)*) - U/RB - grasslands ## Waxbills and allies Order: [Passeriformes](/wiki/Passeriformes) Family: [Estrildidae](/wiki/Estrildidae) The [estrildid finches](/wiki/Estrildid_finch) are small passerine birds of the Old World tropics and [Australasia](/wiki/Australasia). They are gregarious and often colonial seed eaters with short thick but pointed bills. They are all similar in structure and habits, but have wide variation in plumage colours and patterns. - Orange-cheeked waxbill (*[Estrilda melpoda](/wiki/Estrilda_melpoda)*) - U/IRB - BAMKP, Coney Is., JLG, NTL, P. Punggol, S. Pandan, SBTB - Common waxbill (*[Estrilda astrild](/wiki/Estrilda_astrild)*) - U/IRB - Coney Is., Halus, JLG, Marina East, NTL, P. Punggol, Punggol, SBWR - Red avadavat (*[Amandava amandava](/wiki/Amandava_amandava)*) - R/IRB - BAMKP, Changi, Halus, NTL, P. Punggol, Tuas, *Marina South, Punggol* - White-rumped munia (*[Lonchura striata](/wiki/Lonchura_striata)*) - R/RB - BTNR, CCNR, DFNP, Halus, NTL, P. Tekong, P. Ubin, SBG, SBWR, Sentosa, Tuas, Telok Blangah - Javan munia (*[Lonchura leucogastroides](/wiki/Lonchura_leucogastroides)*) - U/IRB - Bidadari, Halus, Hort Park, Marina East, WWC (Murai, Wrexham), SBTB, Serangoon Reservoir, SBWR, BAMKP - Scaly-breasted munia (*[Lonchura punctulata](/wiki/Lonchura_punctulata)*) - C/RB - grasslands - Chestnut munia (*[Lonchura atricapilla](/wiki/Lonchura_atricapilla)*) - U/RB - grasslands - White-capped munia (*[Lonchura ferruginosa](/wiki/Lonchura_ferruginosa)*) - **Ex/IR** - grasslands - White-headed munia (*[Lonchura maja](/wiki/Lonchura_maja)*) - U/RB - grasslands ## Indigobirds Order: [Passeriformes](/wiki/Passeriformes) Family: [Viduidae](/wiki/Viduidae) The indigobirds are finch-like species which usually have black or indigo predominating in their plumage. All are [brood parasites](/wiki/Brood_parasite) which lay their eggs in the nests of [estrildid finches](/wiki/Estrildid_finch). - Pin-tailed whydah (*[Vidua macroura](/wiki/Vidua_macroura)*) - R/I - Changi, Pasir Ris Farmway, P. Punggol, Tuas ## Old World sparrows Order: [Passeriformes](/wiki/Passeriformes) Family: [Passeridae](/wiki/Passeridae) Old World sparrows are small passerine birds. In general, sparrows tend to be small, plump, brown or grey birds with short tails and short powerful beaks. Sparrows are seed eaters, but they also consume small insects. - House sparrow (*[Passer domesticus](/wiki/Passer_domesticus)*) - VR/IRB - Jurong Is. - Eurasian tree sparrow (*[Passer montanus](/wiki/Passer_montanus)*) - VC/RB - urban areas ## Wagtails and pipits Order: [Passeriformes](/wiki/Passeriformes) Family: [Motacillidae](/wiki/Motacillidae) Motacillidae is a family of small passerine birds with medium to long tails. They include the wagtails, longclaws and pipits. They are slender, ground feeding insectivores of open country. - Forest wagtail (*[Dendronanthus indicus](/wiki/Dendronanthus_indicus)*) - U/WVPM - Admiralty Park, BBNP, Bidadari, BTNR, CCNR, Jurong Central Park, Mandai, P. Ubin, Sembawang, Simpang, Tengah, SBWR, Yishun - Grey wagtail (*[Motacilla cinerea](/wiki/Motacilla_cinerea)*) - U/WVPM - Admiralty Park, BAMKP, Bedok, Bt Batok, BTNR, Buona Vista, CCNR, Changi, JLG, Marsiling Park, NTL, Punggol, P. Punggol, P. Ubin, Sembawang, Simpang, Tengah, Yishun - Eastern yellow wagtail (*[Motacilla tschutschensis](/wiki/Motacilla_tschutschensis)*) - C/WV - Bidadari, Changi, Halus, LSD, NTL, P. Punggol, P. Ubin, Punggol, Sembawang, Yishun - Citrine wagtail (*[Motacilla citreola](/wiki/Motacilla_citreola)*) - VR/WV - NTL (2018, 2024), Punggol (1989), Tuas (1994) - White wagtail (*[Motacilla alba](/wiki/Motacilla_alba)*) - U/WV - BAMKP, BBC, Buona Vista, Changi, Jurong West, Marina East, NTL, P. Punggol, Punggol, SBG, TEG, Yishun - Paddyfield pipit (*[Anthus rufulus](/wiki/Anthus_rufulus)*) - C/RB - grass fields - Tree pipit (*[Anthus trivialis](/wiki/Anthus_trivialis)*) - VR/V - Ulu Pandan (2021) - Olive-backed pipit (*[Anthus hodgsoni](/wiki/Anthus_hodgsoni)*) - VR/PM - Bidadari (2010) - Red-throated pipit (*[Anthus cervinus](/wiki/Anthus_cervinus)*) - R/WV - Changi, NTL, P. Punggol, Pasir Ris Farmway, Seletar East, Sembawang, Tuas ## Finches, euphonias, and allies Order: [Passeriformes](/wiki/Passeriformes) Family: [Fringillidae](/wiki/Fringillidae) This is a large family of passerine birds. They are seed-eating birds with generally stout conical bills. - Yellow-fronted canary (*[Crithagra mozambica](/wiki/Crithagra_mozambica)*) - U/IR - BAMKP, Changi, JLG, Kusu Is., Lazarus Is., Marina East, Mt. Faber, St. John Is. ## Old World buntings Order: [Passeriformes](/wiki/Passeriformes) Family: [Emberizidae](/wiki/Emberizidae) They are seed-eating birds with stubby conical bills. There is only one genus in this family. - Yellow-breasted bunting (*[Emberiza aureola](/wiki/Emberiza_aureola)*) - VR/WV - *Marina East* - [Lists of birds by region](/wiki/Lists_of_birds_by_region) - [List of mammals of Singapore](/wiki/List_of_mammals_of_Singapore) - [List of reptiles of Singapore](/wiki/List_of_reptiles_of_Singapore) - [List of amphibians of Singapore](/wiki/List_of_amphibians_of_Singapore) - Lepage, Denis.
